intro: Oligospermum simense, commonly known as the Southern Starflower, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are succulent and have a bluish-green color, while its flowers are usually white or pale blue. Oligospermum simense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively low maintenance once established.
